snippet: Attorney General Eric. H. Holder Jr. said a federal medical examiner would conduct an independent autopsy of Michael Brown as the Obama administration becomes more involved in trying to maintain peace in Ferguson.
abstract: Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr announces that federal medical examiner will conduct independent autopsy of Michael Brown, 18-year-old unarmed African-American man who was fatally shot by police in Ferguson, Mo; move is latest effort by administration to quell firestorm of public anger since shooting and ensure independent investigation.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MATT APUZZO
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Edgartown, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington. Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting from Washington, and Alan Blinder from Ferguson, Mo.

lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric. H. Holder Jr. said a federal medical examiner would conduct an independent autopsy of Michael Brown as the Obama administration becomes more involved in trying to maintain peace in Ferguson.

headline.main: Obama Administration Plans Autopsy of Michael Brown in Effort to Keep Peace
headline.print_headline: White House Efforts to Keep Peace Include Plan for a Justice Dept. Autopsy
